history.content: I would say you should take 70 right away, since the seats available in that class will get cut drastically next fall. I'd push 16B off, especially if you're CS, because it's likely won't be required anymore. If you will be taking those four classes in two semesters, don't take any other technical courses, since all four are very heavy workload and will kill you from the inside.

Hi, going to be a sophomore in EECS next year. I have those 4 lower divs remaining. I would ideally like to split those classes so I have the minimum workload / semester, any advice on how I should split it? Obviously 61b would be the fall semester but would appreciate any advice on when I should take the others. As an aside, hoping to take data 8 in the fall as well (interest in some data courses), and for reference I've found 61A fairly easy so far and have done pretty well on the midterms. 

Edit: any advice on professors to target for lower workloads would be helpful too. I know Weaver is leaving, Hilfinger is retiring, and Sahai is a notoriously high-workload prof, so unsure where that leaves me in terms of these classes. Really appreciate any advice.
history.subject: Split 61b, 70, 61c, 16b into two semesters
